result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Current: 1316 N 5th St, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 03-04-2016)

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 8:40am
INCLUDES 15CM396, 15CM625, 15CM1147 & 15CM1471
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM625
Ct. 1 Battery >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
15CM1147
Ct. 1 Operate w/o Valid License (3rd w/in 3 yrs) >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
15CM1471
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM396
Ct 1 Disorderly Conduct- Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST
15CM625
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST
15CM1471
Ct. 1 Operate w/o valid license (3rd w/in 3 yrs) >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 15CM1471 Ct. 1 pay $5.00 fine plus court costs. Defendent has valid drivers license
COURT ORDERS: 15CM396 Ct. 1 & 15CM625 Ct. 2 - COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
CONDITIONS: complete SAFE program and assessment with any recommendations by agent. No new offenses. Maintain GFE with full time work or full time school, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service. Maintain absolute sobriety. No abusive contact with L.B. and no contact with victim B.H. 
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS 15CM396 Ct. 1 and be charged in 15CM625 Ct. 2 plus pay court costs. 
Parties to set RH date on DEOJ with JA.
Bond continues.
Adj: 9:00am

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CM396, 15CM1147, 15CM1471, 15CM625 called: 8:49am
State appears by ADA L.Gramer. Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer.

COURT questions defendant re: missed appearance; Atty Sawyer statesDefendant mixed up dates and was at work for missed court appearance.
State withdraws motion to forfeit bond -- COURT grants
However, COURT warns defendant he must be present at all his court dates or his bonds may be forfeited.


NEW DATE: to be set -- CC 9/21/15 at 1pm

Clerk Becky/Kassidi
